userreviews.userReview: Yeah I finished it already! I created this profile just so I could leave a review for this book. I'm seldom passionate enough about anything I read to actually sit down and say something about it one way or the other. But I absolutely loved this book. Suspense, Romance, engaging funny characters, murder, twists and turns, hell what else could I ask for. I loved Victor, I mean he was an a$$, but he reminded me of so many people. It was so easy to visualize everything that was going on. What else can I say...I loved it!!!

Night Slashers by Rashad FreemanDaniel Montague has buried a secret for so long. He leads an ordinary life, great career and the perfect wife. But soon people end up dead and his whole world is about to turn upside down. He finds that he can only hide from his past for so long, until it catches up to him.A fast paced murder/thriller. I liked the writing style, the story line, and the suspense. I was at the edge of my seat.A definite all-night read. I highly recommend to those who enjoy a thrilling story!

This is the best book i have read hands down. I really enjoy a good mystery and boy did i get one. There were soo many twists involved. Everytime i thought i knew who did it, they ended up dead and keeping me guessing. You really had to pay attention to the small stuff. Really amazing work.

Night Slasher by Rashad Freeman introduces readers to Daniel Montague, a man trying to leave his past behind. Daniel moves to New Orleans to start a new life. He has a beautiful wife and a thriving surgical practice and believes nothing could go wrong. Unbeknownst to Daniel, his past comes back as unexplained deaths start to stack up. These murders are hitting close to home and Daniel finds himself in the middle. Daniel has to face his past if he hopes to have a future.Night Slasher was a psychological thriller and mystery that had me on the edge of my seat. It had drama, murder and a secret that will shock readers. Having been the first book I have read by this author I can say I really enjoyed the suspense and the unsuspected twist at the end of the book. The book did have a variety of death scenes but the author does a wonderful job with leading up to each scene with great details. On the other hand, Daniel’s flashback in story may throw readers off but they are necessary for readers to relate to his character. I do believe this book would be great for film and applaud this author. This book was provided by the author for review purposes.Teresa BeasleyA&RBC Reviews5 Stars=Non Stop Page Turner

In New Orleans, Daniel Montague is co owner to a popular after hours business. He's a plastic surgeon. With a lucrative career, good friends and a beautiful wife, one could say he has it all. But as we all know, a life filled with glitter is not always gold. When the return of an old friend begins to turn his world upside down, Daniel attempts to cling on to his sanity and the secret he's tried so hard to bury has come to light, and with it, a price to be paid. I was introduced to this book by the author and was glad I took the opportunity to read it. I was intrigued from the first chapter and honestly, I had a hard time putting it down. I liked playing the "guessing game" and loved the authors descriptive story telling...so much that I could picture the scenes as if it was a movie I was watching. The only down side...It was a little too fast paced for me. I wanted to get to know the characters more. perhaps, as the series continues, I'll get more of that. I read this book during the late hours while the house was quiet...perfect setting for this murder mystery.

This is a great story with believable characters and a captivating crime mystery plot. I hope the writer does a sequel, as I got rabidly interested in how the tangled web of intrigue would be resolved. I'm only giving the book three stars, however, because I was turned off by poor grammar and syntax, lack of commas or misplaced commas, dismbiguations, and malapropisms. "Lawsuit" is one word, not two words, and the stunt daredevil is Evil Knievel, not ""Evil Ken evil." There's sophisticated software out there, free online, to check not just spelling but also grammar and sentence structure. Disambiguations and malapropisms can be spotted electronically. Even clumsy paragraphs can be red-flagged. With a little more focus and the same fresh ideas, it is entirely possible that the young Mr. Freeman (no relation) will make it to the New York Times list of bestsellers. I will be waiting, with baited breath!!!

The protagonist, Daniel is this cool mysterious man who had me at hello. His friend Tom seems like that type that gets more girls, but Daniel's the one you take home to the folks. The book overall was like speeding down a twisty road in the dark with no brakes. When things happened, they happened and smacked you right in the face.

I was really eager to get this book after reading the excerpt in Apocalypse. I read this in two days and absolutely loved it. What a twist at the end. It's a real different feel from his other works, but wow it was a great thriller. Two thumbs up!!!
Serious page turner. Totally had me fooled with that ending. Do I smell a spin off???
Kind of a step out of the ordinary for him since I've only read paranormal and sci fi from this author, but really good thriller. The twist was priceless.

It was a bit of a love hate relationship with this book… and I tend to have that towards this genre which is why I don’t read them often but I do like it when I find a well told one… which this was… it is a dark and twisted tale… and though it was a bit graphic it didn’t rely on gore to scare you… it was very much a psychological thriller as you have that feeling that someone is coming for you… I liked how it was mixed in with the everyday things… Daniel would be out shopping for baby stuff and find out another body was found… be at the bar to learn another had dropped… it could’ve been anyone anywhere and that’s what made it so terrifying… the normal vibe that surrounded it… and each time you think you know who the killer is or why it’s happening Freeman throws a monkey wrench in the mix and you’re left wondering who will be taken out next… and the ending was a huge surprise… like the sort you just never expect to really happen… But my problem with this book… other than the fact Freeman kept using ‘piece’ instead of ‘peace’… was how unlikeable the characters were… in the beginning you know some just weren’t meant to be liked… but as you get further in there’s pretty much no one left to like… as they become wrapped up in this you can understand they may not be at their best but you’d think like Daniel and Tom would make some smarter choices… but the as you really get into the story, Daniel goes from being this likeable man that you fear for to being rather arrogant and snide… and even though there were lots of times that I was wondering if he was the one behind it all… after all he does have blackouts where he doesn’t know how he came to be where he was… and yes it may sounds strange to want a potential murderer to me more likable… but the further in it got the less I felt for him… and that bothered me… but ultimately the book was pretty great… it didn’t get dragged out and there was plenty of excitement… definitely one worth reading…

I'm in LOVE....This book had me all over the place...in a good way. It was a twisted and warped story that I loved every minute of. Rashad Freeman you are my hero. I'm developing a book crush. Don't waste your money on this book. And if it is free, don't waste your time. The editing is horrible. During attacks, the author keeps switching from 'attacker' to 'attackers' or 'them'. There is only one attacker, so it is confusing using plurals. If a high school English student did this, his/her teacher would deduct marks and perhaps explain the error, but this guy gets published??? What a strange world, in which this gets published with errors still in it. It happens a lot lately, particularly with e-books. Are editors too expensive? Are authors illiterate? In any case, some readers (not me) could forgive this if the story is suspenseful and engaging, but this is really not. It kind of goes nowhere and gets quite dull in places, despite its short length, leaving the reader to not really care that much about the ending, which, well, I won't spoil it, but let me reiterate, don't waste your time. To any authors reading this review, please edit your work carefully or have someone do it for you before it gets published and becomes open to criticism. Publishing a book with errors is as avoidable as it is stupid.

This book grabs you from the very beginning and does not let you go until you way after the end, as you sit there trying to process the full extent of what you have just read.. For someone like me who is not a huge fan of murder thrillers this book delivered a lot more than I was expecting. The character and plot development was just superb and each chapter had that little hook to drag you further into the story. I am not going to go into the storyline here because I don't want to ruin or diminish any of the impact of this first rate story for the reader.This book for me once again highlights to me all that is good about Indie authors and that is a vibrant and creative revolution of the publishing industry. I look forward to diving into more of this authors offerings in the near future.

I enjoyed this book. The characters were interstimg, fun and engaging. It was a quick read and full of intrigue and suspense. The ending might be a little outrageous but, nevertheless, lends itself well to a follow-up sequel. I feel Rashad has some great potential and knows how to tell a good story. I do agree with one review that the editing needs a little more attention. All said, thumbs-up.

description: Daniel Montague has a secret. A secret so dark, so disturbing that even he doesn't remember it. The winding waters of the Mississippi River give him solace. They hold his deepest mysteries like a vault, but now the murky abyss is breaking at the seams.When an old friend shows up and a rash of murders brings an echo from the past, Daniel's life is thrown into a cyclone. Now he must fight to keep his wife and unborn son alive, while trying to solve a mystery that keeps getting closer to home.They say to live in the present you have to forget the past. But what if the past can’t forget you?
title: Night Slashers
